result.execSummary:
The defendant Creston A. Ballman #397861 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On each count concurrent but consecutive to any other sentence with zero days credit. Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program. (1-14-15 Motion hearing to modify sentence held.  Court allows for programs)  (1-29-15  2nd AJC, zero days credit)

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia. No intoxicants. Maintan Absolute Sobriety.

Complete compas assessment, counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.  Defendant shall Submit to Random Urinalysis.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Extradition fee due to Winnebago County Sheriff's Department.

supervisions.notes: On each count concurrent but consecutive to any other sentence.
